name: (2Z,5alpha,17beta)-17-Hydroxy-2-(hydroxymethylene)-17-methylandrostan-3-one
Reason: Target compound: (2Z,5alpha,17beta)-17-Hydroxy-2-(hydroxymethylene)-17-methylandrostan-3-one. The basic structure of the molecule is steroidal, and steroids typically have a relatively high melting point due to the rigid, planar structure of the steroid nucleus. Cyclohexane, as a reference of a simple hydrocarbon ring, has a melting point of around 6.5 degrees Celsius. The multiple rings in the steroid contribute to overall higher melting point through increased van der Waals interactions and restrictive molecular motion (+100 degrees Celsius for the steroid nucleus). Hydroxyl groups generally increase melting point due to capacity for hydrogen bonding (+40 for each hydroxyl group, total of +80 for two hydroxyls). The presence of the hydroxymethylene group can be thought to increase melting point similarly to a hydroxyl, due to its polarity and potential for hydrogen bonding (+40). The keto group also increases melting point due to dipole interactions (+20). The androstan derivative is slightly more complex than a simple steroid, suggesting a slightly higher baseline. Taking into account these functional groups, the additions are cumulative. However, since the functional groups are in close proximity, their individual contributions might not manifest entirely additively. An approximate summation with slight adjustment for non-additive effects would be used for the prediction.
Prediction: 6.5 (cyclohexane base) + 100 (steroid nucleus) + 80 (two hydroxyl groups) + 40 (hydroxymethylene) + 20 (keto group) - 10 (adjustment for non-additive proximity effects) = 236.5 degrees Celsius
